name: John Glascock
description:
'''John Glascock''' (2 May 1951 â€“ 17 November 1979) was a British musician. He was the bassist and occasional lead vocalist of the [[Rock music|rock]] band [[Carmen (band)|Carmen]] from 1972 to 1975; and the bass guitarist for [[progressive rock]] band [[Jethro Tull (band)|Jethro Tull]] from 1976 until his death in 1979. Glascock died at the age of 28 as a result of a [[Congenital disorder|congenital]] heart valve defect, which was worsened by an infection caused by an abscessed tooth.

In a September 1978 ''[[Guitar Player]]'' interview, [[Ritchie Blackmore]] said "John Glascock is a brilliant bass player, the best in the business in rock."
